meanings.definition: Past tense and past participle of breed.
meanings.sent1: The dog was bred for hunting.
meanings.sent2: The farm animals were bred for their wool.
meanings.sent3: The cat was bred for herding sheep, but she prefers napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The roses were bred to withstand harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent5: The champion racehorse was bred for speed and endurance.

meanings.definition: Developed or trained for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The well-bred dog was obedient and loyal.
meanings.sent2: She is a well-bred lady with impeccable manners.
meanings.sent3: The well-bred horse won the competition with grace and style.
meanings.sent4: The well-bred chef prepared a delicious meal with precision and skill.
meanings.sent5: The well-bred athlete showed sportsmanship and determination in the game.

meanings.sent1: The rare flower is bred only in this region.
meanings.sent2: The unique blend of coffee is bred by a local roaster.
meanings.sent3: The new species of fish was bred in a laboratory for research purposes.
meanings.sent4: The innovative technology was bred from years of experimentation.
meanings.sent5: The exceptional talent of the artist was bred from a young age through practice and dedication.
